body:
Temporary workaround maybe ?

By reading at dropbox documentation here about rate limits (https://www.dropbox.com/developers/reference/data-ingress-guide) it seems that the rate limit is set per oauth token / app linked.

`Rate limits are applied to the OAuth access token used to make the request. For user-linked apps this means rate limits apply per user who has linked your app. Multiple apps that a user may have linked don’t contribute to each other’s rate limiting.`

If we re-issue a `rclone authorize "dropbox"` it regenerate the api token but the app remains the same. 

I was wondering if there could be a trick to have multiple rclone apps inside dropbox to bypass this rate limit and have in the rclone config file several remote sections for dropbox: `dropbox`, `dropbox2`, etc

Using the Retry-After header is the proper way of dealing with this.

Unfortunately [Dropbox's SDK doesn't](https://github.com/dropbox/dropbox-sdk-go-unofficial) pass through the Retry-After header to rclone.

I made an [upstream issue](https://github.com/dropbox/dropbox-sdk-go-unofficial/issues/33) to discuss possible solutions.

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

See #1788

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

No - just on #1798 and https://github.com/dropbox/dropbox-sdk-go-unofficial/issues/33

#### Checklist

- [ ] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [ ] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [ ] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

Didn't do anything of that because this PR is a PoC to test the Retry-After support vs `--tpsLimit`.
It also depends on Dropbox's SDK support.
This is just a working base.

#### Disclaimer

Not a Go dev, and do not know the rclone internals (such as the impact on the pacer or whether we still need it), so I strongly suggest a big review for this one, or take the code and update it.

body:
A PR has been opened (#2622): I have exposed the Retry-After sent by dropbox. But... It is always 300 sec it seems... So it triggers a wait of 5min each time dropbox asks to sleep... Which is quite big... So here are some tests I did with one of my big sync task.

With the latest rclone and `--skip-links --modify-window 2s --log-level INFO --tpslimit 9`: sync time is ~54mins

With the modifications from #2622 and `--skip-links --modify-window 2s --log-level DEBUG`, it uses the Retry-After value that is sent back by dropbox and then we can see some wait during 5 minutes, as seen below in the logs. This same big sync task finishes in ~30mins...

In both cases, no transfer happens, only checks.

So I see value in supporting Retry-After for sync tasks that are short and thus would benefit of a higher request rate, but also that are long, like in this case. So generally speaking, even if Dropbox 5mins wait time seems big, using it instead of a low request rate (`--tpslimit 9`) is better.

```

I'm currently seeing this too. My Dropbox has over 100,000 files and 30TB+ of data. The `sync` was running nicely until I quit it by accident when it was at 95%. Upon re-running the `sync`, rclone chugs through most files quickly because they haven't changed. Then at some point, the rate limit issue comes up, and all retries fail. After 95k files, I start getting:
```
2019-04-25 18:31:09 DEBUG : too_many_requests/.: Too many requests or write operations. Trying again in 300 seconds.

and on and on. Restarting sync right away results in a too_many_request. If I wait some time, I can run it again, but eventually it stops working again. What shall I do?

issue.title: Dropbox Retry after : log in INFO

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
When Dropbox answers with a too many requests / Retry-After header, an INFO log line should be outputted. Right now, nothing is outputted, so we only the that the process is still there but nothing happens. So a bit confusing.

I would advice to put a log line in INFO telling the user that rclone needs to wait 300 sec before retrying because of the too many requests occurred.

body:
I am experiencing this issue and am mainly concerned about an additional problem that it brings, namely that file handles that error out on "too many write operations" are not released which causes the number of open handles to slowly increase. On my debian system this causes rclone to crash with "too many open files" once the number of maximum handles is reached.

`2019/09/17 14:06:43 DEBUG : multisite/wp-content/themes/digikit/vendor/mollie/mollie-api-php/examples/shipments/update-shipment.php: Unchanged skipping
2019/09/17 14:06:43 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 1/1 (error too_many_write_operations/..)
2019/09/17 14:06:43 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 20ms
2019/09/17 14:06:43 DEBUG : multisite/wp-content/uploads/sites/66/2014/01/Dorpenlab-Hornhuizen-2.jpg: Received error: upload failed: too_many_write_operations/.. - low level retry 1/10
2019/09/17 14:06:43 DEBUG : pacer: Reducing sleep to 15ms`

Setting the tpslimit (the lowest i've tried is 5) does not seem to prevent the number of handles to slowly rise to the maximum.

@litemotiv @davidbitton  : what are the rclone version and the command-line parameters ?
Also, do you happen do run different rclone process in parallel at the same time or not ?

_UPDATE_

I have a Dropbox account with a lot of files / projects too, and I also see Dropbox answering by `too_many_requests` and the rclone pacer triggering on, which is a normal behaviour. But I do not have and file handle issues (Macos, rclone v1.49.2, os/arch: darwin/amd64, go version: go1.13)

@mathieucarbou I'm currently using this version:

`rclone v1.49.0-071-gab89e939-beta
os/arch: linux/amd64
go version: go1.13`

Command-line:

`rclone sync -vv -L --log-file=log.txt --tpslimit=5 <source> dropbox:<dest>`

I'm running a single rclone process in a terminal, so far the behaviour has been 100% reproducible on my system.
@mathieucarbou Since you don't have this issue with open file handles i won't hijack your ticket and will open a new one with a reference to this one.

> Since you don't have this issue with open file handles i won't hijack your ticket and will open a new one with a reference to this one.

That would be great - thank you @litemotiv .  If you do a run with `--dump openfiles,goroutines` that will provide useful diagnostics
